page.title: 12Reading's Third Bridge
page.content: In 1983 a traffic survey was done. It showed that 800 cars went over Sonning's old bridge in an hour so that people have to queue there. 2500 cars used Caversham Bridge and 1200 _ 1500 an hour used Reading Bridge. Three_quarters ofthe traffic was from Caversham and one quarter from villages outside Caversham. If there is a new bridge, should it be a motorway bridge, and let the government pay, or should it be a local bridge? Should there be no new bridge at all? The County Council has said, "A local bridge for local needs" and "The bridge should not be a motorway bridge".{Now a new bridge may {be built in between Reading Bridge and {Sonning's old bridge, between the {gravel pits to join the Henley road at {the bottom of Caversham Park Village.
